questions.text: A 10-year-old child is being evaluated for short stature. Her height was found to be 120 cm, with sitting height being 70 cm. Which of the following can be the likely cause of short stature in this child?
Which of the following syndromes cannot be diagnosed via Karyotyping?
A child with short stature underwent karyotyping and the following was seen. Tell the likely diagnosis?
A child is having chronic diarrhea and crypt hyperplasia with villous atrophy. Which of the following will be positive?

choices.text: Severe pneumonia; refer to higher center with O2

questions.text: An 8-month-old child presented with fever, cough, respiratory rate of 52/min and chest indrawing. No other abnormality was noted. Likely diagnosis & management?

A 2-year-old boy presented with complaints of passing 8-10 watery stools per day since 2 days, some which are slightly greenish in colour. There is, however, no blood or mucus. He has some irritability, BP of 96/60 mm Hg, eagerly drinking water & has delayed skin pinch test. Which of the following shall be recommended in this child?

A female neonate at birth had ambiguous genitalia. Suspecting CAH, she was evaluated and found to have high 17-hydroxyprogesterone, high progesterone, high DHEAS and low cortisol. Likely enzyme deficient?
A neonate found to have the following at birth, along with birth weight of 4.1 kg. What metabolic abnormalities will you look for?

choices.text: Transferring objects from hand to hand

questions.text: Which of the following is the first to appear in a child?

choices.text: Vitamin K injection soon after birth
Wiping eyes with a saline soaked gauze from medial to lateral direction
Bathing gently with warm water, only below neck
Providing thermal care by skin to skin contact

questions.text: As a part of routine care, all of the following can be done in a normal child after birth except?
A 3 week old neonate is brought with complaints of multiple episodes of projectile, clear vomiting. USG revealed antral nipple sign. Next step in management?
An unimmunized 5 year old boy is brought with sickness including cough, LAP and fever. There is a grey-white pseudomembrane on the tonsils. Immediate next step to do?

A neonate delivered via normal vaginal delivery is started on mother's feed. He developed vomiting, hypoglycemia, oil drop cataract, hepatomegaly and mild icterus. Urine was positive for reducing substance, but no glucose. The likely enzyme deficiency is?

A term neonate was found to have poor respiratory efforts after birth and was started on neonatal resuscitation. During initial assessment, he had scaphoid abdomen, with HR of 90/min. What is the immediate next step in management after initial steps?

A 1-month-old child born to HIV+ mother is on daily nevirapine prophylaxis with exclusive breastfeedings. The child developed progressive respiratory distress & loose stools. What test will you likely do to check for HIV status in the child?
Not a major risk factor for febrile seizure recurrence?
Down syndrome children have decreased risk of developing the following as compared to general population?
A baby born to O+ve mother developed jaundice within 24 hr of birth. What is the immediate next step to do?

choices.text: Most Common cause of Non-Syndromic SNHL in children
Confirmation can be done by urine culture or PCR after 4 weeks of age
In developing countries, primary maternal infection can lead to congenital CMV

questions.text: Which of the following is true about Congenital CMV Infection?
A child has recently learnt to start walking holding to furniture, as shown in the picture. What is the age at which this milestone is first attained?
A child has recently learnt to copy the image as shown below. Assuming that the child's development is proceeding normally, what other thing the child will be able to do at this age?

choices.text: Catching a ball thrown from a distance

questions.text: A general practitioner referred a 3-year-old child to a specialist for evaluation for suspected development delay. Absence of which of the following at 3 years will constitute development delay in a child?
Least common manifestation of congenital Parvovirus B19 infection is?

choices.text: Anti measles IgG antibody in CSF
MRI Brain for mesial temporal sclerosis

questions.text: A 12-year-old child is suffering from myoclonic jerks throughout the day since 1 month. Teacher reports irritability and loss of concentration. Parents give no significant history other than fever with rash that the child had at 1 year of age which resolved spontaneously. There is also associated EEG abnormalities. What investigation will lead you to the diagnosis?
An 11-year-old child has Acute Rheumatic Fever and has no cardiac manifestations. What should the duration of antibiotic prophylaxis?

choices.text: MR Vaccine s.c. on left arm & Oral Vit A, at 9 months completed
MR Vaccine s.c. on right arm & Oral Vit A, at 9 months completed
MR Vaccine s.c. on left arm & Oral Vit A, at 8 months completed
MR Vaccine s.c. on right arm & Oral Vit A, at 8 months completed

questions.text: A baby has received BCG at birth and has been vaccinated at 14 weeks. Which of the following shall be given on the next visit, along with route and site?
A child has been recently diagnosed as Celiac Disease. His parents ask you for foods which are safe to be consumed. You will suggest all of the following foods as safe to eat in this patient, except?

A neonate was delivered by LSCS at 26 weeks of gestation. He was managed for RDS & is being monitored in ICU and is currently started on IV Fluids with TPN being planned. The parents enquire when they would be able to breastfeed the child. This child can be breastfed after what postnatal age of the child is attained?

An 8-year-old child presented with periorbital edema and mild oliguria but no hypertension. On evaluation, he was found to have serum albumin <2.5 g/dl, Serum creatinine 0.5 mg/dl, urine protein 3+ and no RBCs or RBC casts in the urine. What histopathological diagnosis will you suspect?

A 6-month-old girl is brought to the ED for excessive fussiness and colicky behavior. On exam, she has repetitive clusters of stereotyped flexion movements of the trunk, associated with a cry. Her EEG shows hypsarrhythmia. A few flexion movements are captured and are associated with a generalized slow wave followed by an electro-decrement. She has several scattered hypo-pigmented spots on the trunk and extremities. What is the best treatment option?
Which of the following is true regarding growth of a child?

A term neonate with Rh incompatibility developed severe unconjugated hyperbilirubinemia. The baby was managed with phototherapy and required two cycles of exchange transfusion as well as IVIG. On follow-up he was found to have recurrent seizures, had abnormal hearing screening test and at 1 year of age, he was diagnosed to have developed cerebral palsy. His MRI revealed evidence of past damage in bilateral thalami and putamen. Which of the following is the likely type of cerebral palsy you will suspect in this child?

choices.text: Nasal wash for influenza and RSV

questions.text: A 2.5-year-old child presents with high grade fever, barking cough and stridor while crying. Child accepts fluids normally. On examination respiratory rate is 34/ min and temperature of 102 F. Next best step of management?
What is the most common cause of death in Kawasaki disease?

choices.text: Loss of provisional zone of calcification

questions.text: Which among the following is not an X-ray feature of Rickets?
A 3-day-old neonate is on IV Fluids. He has a birth weight less than 1500 grams. What shall be the amount of fluid?
In a child with neonatal jaundice, which of the following will have unconjugated hyperbilirubinemia?
A child presented with strong upper limb pulses and weak lower limb pulses. What is the likely diagnosis?
What is the likely diagnosis in the girl child having short stature and features as shown?

You are evaluating a child with Kwashiorkor. The child is having edema on legs as well as on face and chest wall. However, ascites is not present. Which among the following shall be the likely grade of Kwashiorkor?
